intro: Hyperogyne, commonly known as the genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae, consists of shrubs and trees characterized by their showy, often colorful flowers. The plants typically have palmate or lobed leaves and produce capsules as their fruiting bodies. Hyperogyne species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms. The genus includes several species that are used in traditional medicine and horticulture.
